definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: Say, read the book you see smoke on the fetal well, easy to teratogenicity .
sentences.chinese: 就说你看到书上写着抽烟对胎儿不好，容易致畸。

sentences.english: We don't tolerate smoking in the library.
sentences.chinese: 我们不容许在图书馆里抽烟。

sentences.english: Althogh I tried to pursuade him to stop smoking, he still could not make his mind.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我尽力劝他别抽烟了，他还是下不了决心。

sentences.english: It is claimed that nobody is to smoke at college.
sentences.chinese: 有人主张，在大学里面谁也不应该抽烟。

sentences.english: Tom scorched his jacket carelessly while he was smoking his pipe .
sentences.chinese: 汤姆抽烟斗时不小心把夹克烧焦。

sentences.english: According to the Chinese tradition's idea, smokes is the bad woman's symbol.
sentences.chinese: 按照中国人传统的观念，抽烟是坏女人的象征。

sentences.english: When did you start smoking, Sail'?
sentences.chinese: 小赛，你什么时候开始抽烟的？

sentences.english: My counsel asked the doorkeeper if he, too, hadn't smoked.
sentences.chinese: 这时，我的律师问门房是否和我一道抽烟了。

sentences.english: I also decided to replace smoking with running.
sentences.chinese: 同时，我还决定用跑步来代替抽烟。

sentences.english: You smoke too much—you should try to cut down.
sentences.chinese: 你抽烟太凶了，该少抽点。

sentences.english: Current smoking was the most significant independent predictor of coronary vasospasm.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是最显著的冠状动脉痉挛预测因子。

sentences.english: An art student from Hong Kong on Nanluoguxiang.
sentences.chinese: 香港来得艺术学生在垃圾桶旁边抽烟。

sentences.english: The bunch of teenagers who spend their afternoons smoking in the local railway station?
sentences.chinese: 一群整个下午都在本地火车站抽烟的小青年？

sentences.english: Don't you think smoking too much is harmful to your health?
sentences.chinese: 难道你没想过抽烟太多害你健康吗？

sentences.english: He has forsaken the bad habit of smoking.
sentences.chinese: 他有边吃饭边抽烟那让人讨厌的习惯。

sentences.english: My aunt never drank alcohol or smoked. Her cancer was completely caused by pollution.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈从来不抽烟喝酒，她的癌症肯定是污染引起的。

definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
heavy drinking/to get drunk/to drink to excess
(fig.) to have a meeting with state security agents (to be warned to behave "responsibly")
